thread.title: Nice views: Tallest building in each state in the USA
thread.title_full: Nice views: Tallest building in each state in the USA

title: Nice views: Tallest building in each state in the USA
text: Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Nice views: Tallest building in each state in the USA Which state holds America's tallest? And which state's measures only 124 feet tall? Post to Facebook Nice views: Tallest building in each state in the USA Which state holds America's tallest? And which state's measures only 124 feet tall? Check out this story on lcsun-news.com: http://usat.ly/2jUzQ0x Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. 5 To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Nice views: Tallest building in each state in the USA Kori Hill, Special for USA TODAY 5:46 a.m. MT Feb. 1, 2017 Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Alabama - RSA Battle House Tower is the tallest building in Alabama, located in Mobile. It was opened in 2007, has 35 floors, and is 745 feet tall. 80monkeys, Getty Images/iStockphoto Alaska - Construction on the Conoco-Phillips Building was finished in 1983 and it remains Alaska’s tallest building. Located in Anchorage, it is 22 stories and 296 feet tall. ChrisBoswell, Getty Images/iStockphoto Arizona - Chase Tower in Phoenix is Arizona’s tallest building and has held the title since 1972. It is 40 stories (and 483 feet) tall, but the highest occupiable floor is number 38. Christian J. Stewart, Getty Images/iStockphoto Arkansas - Located in Little Rock is Simmons Tower, Arkansas’ tallest building. It was finished in 1986 and boasts 40 stories at 546 feet tall. James Fisher Fullscreen California - The building now known as U.S. Bank Tower (it’s had a few titles in its time) is California’s tallest skyscraper. Located in Los Angeles and standing 73 stories high, it is also the 14th tallest building in the United States. It was completed in 1989. (The Wilshire Grand Center will surpass the U.S. Bank Tower when it opens in March.) David Liu, Getty Images/iStockphoto Colorado - The Republic Plaza building in Denver, Colorado is the tallest building in Denver at 56 stories and 714 feet tall. It was built in 1984 and has over a million square feet of office space. james brown, Getty Images/iStockphoto Fullscreen Connecticut - City Place is the tallest building in Connecticut, but only two meters taller than The Travelers Tower, built in 1919. City Place took the superlative in 1980. Both buildings are in Hartford. City Place comes in at 38 stories and 535 feet tall. Natalia Bratslavsky, Getty Images/iStockphoto Delaware - In Wilmington, Delaware, the River Tower at Christina Landing takes the spot for tallest building in Delaware with 27 floors and 340 feet tall. It was built in 2007 and contains residences. M. Williams Florida - The tallest building in Florida is mainly a hotel, but also includes residences and office space. The Four Seasons Hotel & Tower in Miami was finished in 2003 and has 70 floors, standing 789 feet tall. kschulze, Getty Images/iStockphoto Georgia - Bank of America Plaza in Atlanta, Georgia is the tallest building in the state and the 13th tallest in the USA. Built in 1992, it stands 1,023 feet tall and includes 55 floors. klausbalzano, Getty Images Fullscreen Hawaii - The First Hawaiian Center is the tallest building in Hawaii and is also the corporate headquarters of the oldest and largest bank in the state. Standing at 30 floors and 429 feet tall, it is one of the most well known buildings in Honolulu. Fred Hong Idaho - Zion's Bank Building in Boise is the tallest building in Idaho at 18 stories and 323 feet. It is also referred to as Eighth and Main. It is a new building, construction having finished in 2014. James Edmondson Fullscreen Illinois - Formerly known as the Sears Tower, Willis Tower is the tallest building in Chicago and all of Illinois. Build in 1975, for 25 years, it held the title of tallest building in the world. Currently, it now is just the 2nd tallest in the USA at 108 floors and 1,451 feet tall. Jupiterimages, Getty Images Indiana - At 49 stories and 830 feet tall, Chase Tower in Indianapolis is the tallest building in Indiana. It was finished in 1990 and has been known to hang banners cheering on local professional sports teams. csfotoimages, Getty Images Iowa - 801 Grand in Des Moines, Iowa was built in 1991 and remains the tallest building in the state at 45 floors and 630 feet tall. benkrut, Getty Images/iStockphoto Kansas - Epic Center has an apt name, as it's the tallest building Kansas. Completed in 1989, the building is in the city of Wichita, rises 320 feet tall and includes 22 floors. Justin Londagin Fullscreen Kentucky - 400 West Market is located in downtown Louisville, Kentucky and is 35 stories and 549 feet tall. In the days between Thanksgiving and Christmas, the tower displays red and green lights. It’s been the tallest building in the state since it opened in 1993. benkrut, Getty Images/iStockphoto Louisiana - One Shell Square is 51 stories and 697 feet high, making it the tallest building in the state of Louisiana. It even rises higher than Louisiana’s tallest peak! matabum, Getty Images/iStockphoto Maine - Portland’s Franklin Towers is the tallest building in Maine. Built in 1969 and standing at 16 stories and 175 feet tall, it ranks 47th on the list of tallest buildings in each state. SkyF, Getty Images/iStockphoto Maryland - The Transamerica Tower in Baltimore was finished in 1973. It rises 40 stories and 529 feet into the sky, making it the tallest building in Maryland. marcutti, Getty Images Massachusetts - The 200 Clarendon building in Boston is also known as the John Hancock Tower. At 70 stories and 790 feet tall and built in 1976, it has been the tallest building in Massachusetts for 30 years. Bodhichita, Getty Images/iStockphoto Fullscreen Michigan - The Renaissance Center in Detroit, commonly referred to as the RenCen, is a series of skyscrapers located on the city’s International waterfront. It is owned by General Motors and was built in 1977. The structure is 73 floors and 755 feet tall. Gary Marx II, Getty Images/iStockphoto Minnesota - The IDS Center is the tallest building in Minnesota and has been since 1972. Located in Minneapolis, it is 57 stories and 792 feet tall. Joe Christensen, Getty Images/iStockphoto Mississippi - The tallest building in Mississippi also happens to be a casino. Built in 1999, the Beau Rivage is an MGM Resort located on the water in Biloxi, Mississippi. It has 28 floors and is 347 feet tall. Rian Castillo Fullscreen Missouri - At 42 floors and 634 feet tall, One Kansas City Place is the tallest building in Missouri. It was finished in 1988, and was originally supposed to be a part of a series of buildings, of which it would have been the third tallest. Marek Slusarczyk, Getty Montana - First Interstate Center is the tallest building in Montana. It was built in Billings in 1985 and rises 20 stories and 272 feet high. Chris Van Dyke Nebraska - In Omaha, the First National Bank Tower rises as the tallest building in the state at 634 feet tall. It is a 45 story skyscraper and was completed in 2002. steveodonnell, Getty Images/iStockphoto Fullscreen Nevada - Along the Las Vegas strip is The Palazzo hotel and casino. It is not only the tallest building and casino among the other structures in America’s adult playground, it is also the tallest building in all of Nevada at 642 feet and 50 stories. In terms of square-footage, it is the second largest building in the world. Aneese, Getty Images New Hampshire - City Hall Plaza in Manchester takes the tallest prize in New Hampshire. It was built in 1992 and is 20 stories and 275 feet tall. Getty New Jersey - Jersey City’s 30 Hudson Street skyscraper is the tallest building in the state of New Jersey. Completed in 2004, it is 42 stories and 781 feet tall, and is visible from New York City. Songquan Deng, Getty Images/iStockphoto New Mexico - Albuquerque Plaza is is the taller of two high rise structures in downtown Albuquerque, New Mexico at 22 stories and 351 feet. The other tower, the Hyatt Regency, is 20 stories. The complex was finished in 1990. David Liu, Getty Images/iStockphoto Fullscreen New York - One World Trade Center is famous not just for being the tallest in New York. Also referred to as “Freedom Tower”, it was built in place of the Twin Towers, which fell during the terror attacks of 9/11. The height of the building is 1776 feet, in honor of the year of American independence. Opening in 2014 and totalling 104 stories (but 94 actual floors), it’s also the tallest building in the western hemisphere. batuhanozdel, Getty Images/iStockphoto North Carolina - The Bank of America Corporate Center in Charlotte is the tallest building in North Carolina. At 40 floors and 871 feet tall, it holds Bank of America’s world headquarters. stonena7, Getty Images Fullscreen North Dakota - In North Dakota, the state capitol building takes the crown for the tallest building. Located in Bismarck, the structure is 21 stories and 242 feet tall, and had to be built after a fire ravaged the original capitol building in 1930. The main, tall tower was built between 1931 and 1934, with multiple additions happening over the years. sframephoto, Getty Images/iStockphoto Fullscreen Ohio - The Key Tower in Cleveland, Ohio is the tallest building in the state and the 23rd tallest in the US. Built in 1991, it is 57 floors and 947 feet tall and contains 1.5 million square feet in office space. portgrimes, Getty Images/iStockphoto Oklahoma - Built in 2011, Devon Tower in Oklahoma City is 50 floors and 850 feet tall, making it the tallest building in Oklahoma. It surpassed the BOK Tower in Tulsa, which was built in 1975. Buck-Buchanan, Getty Images Fullscreen Oregon - Completed in 1972, Wells Fargo Center is a 40 story, 546 foot tall building in Portland that claims the state’s tallest building status. The regional headquarters for Wells Fargo, the lobby is home to an authentic 1870 stagecoach that is a part of the bank’s history. Daniel Deitschel, Getty Images/iStockphoto Pennsylvania - Comcast Center is a 57 story, 973 foot tall skyscraper in Philadelphia. It is the tallest building in Pennsylvania and is the world headquarters of Comcast cable company. They take up 89% of the building. Marek Slusarczyk, Getty Fullscreen Rhode Island - The tallest building in Rhode Island has had a lot of names. It used to be called the Industrial Trust Tower, followed by the Bank of America Building. Now it’s referred to as its address, 111 Westminster. But the most common (yet unofficial) name is the Superman Building. The tower was built in Providence in 1927 and is 26 floors high and 428 feet tall. coleong, Getty Images/iStockphoto South Carolina - The Capitol Center in Columbia, South Carolina is the state’s tallest building. Built in 1987, it is 25 stories and 349 feet tall. SeanPavonePhoto, Getty Images/iStockphoto South Dakota - CenturyLink Tower in Sioux Falls is the tallest building in South Dakota at 11 stories and 174 feet. It has dominated the city’s skyline since it was built in 1986. Lisa Eide Tennessee - The AT&T Building in Nashville, Tennessee is often referred to as the Batman building because of its resemblance to the comic book character. It is 33 stories and 617 feet tall, and was completed in 1994. Sean Pavone, Getty Images Fullscreen Texas - JPMorgan Chase Tower in Houston, Texas is the tallest building in Texas, the 17th tallest building in the US, and also the tallest 5-sided building in the world. It was completed in 1982, includes 75 floors and 52 elevators, and rises 1,002 feet. LUNAMARINA, Getty Images/iStockphoto Utah - The Wells Fargo Center in Salt Lake City is the tallest building in Utah at 24 stories and 422 feet. It opened in 1998. portgrimes, Getty Images/iStockphoto Vermont - Decker Towers in Burlington, Vermont has the distinguishing title of the shortest tallest state building. Built in 1970, it has just 11 floors and rises only 124 feet. ErikaMitchell, Getty Images Fullscreen Virginia - In Virginia Beach, The Westin Virginia Beach Town Center has the title of tallest building in Virginia. Built in 2007, it is a 38-story high rise and unseated a building in Richmond for the top spot at 508 feet tall. William Lee Washington - The Columbia Center in Seattle is the tallest skyscraper in the state and the second tallest on the West Coast. It is 76 stories and 943 feet tall, and covered in Rosa Purino Carnelian granite. Stephen Finn, Getty Images/iStockphoto Fullscreen West Virginia - Like North Dakota, West Virginia’s tallest building is its state capitol. But it’s a very different building from the modern tower that stands in Bismarck. The West Virginia capitol, located in Charleston, was built in 1925 and is 292 feet tall while only including four floors. ABEMOS, Getty Images/iStockphoto Fullscreen Wisconsin - The U.S. Bank Center in Milwaukee is the tallest building in Wisconsin at 42 stories and 601 feet tall. It opened in 1973 and is famous for nesting Peregrine falcons outside the 41st floor. Since the program launched, 67 falcons have been successfully fledged by the building. EunikaSopotnicka, Getty Images/iStockphoto Wyoming - White Hall is a dormitory building at the University of Wyoming in Laramie. It is also the tallest building in the state at 12 stories and 200 feet tall. University of Wyoming Residence Life & Dining Services Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay
